page.title: 01STRATFORD ON AVON(SOUTH)
page.content: With the exception of London itself, Stratford is probably the best known town in England.William Shakespeare's life in Stratford certainly accounts for a great deal of its popularity but it is also a beautiful and picturesque town in its own right .Stratford is still in many ways ,the tidy Tudor town it once was,interspersed with cafes,modern restaurants and 20th century shopping facilities.New, has been skillfully and gracefully blended with old resulting in a town full of character but surrounded by modern residential development .The River Avon runs through the south of Stratford and the rolling, peaceful countryside dotted with small villages Land is intensively farmed with a mixture of arable and dairy farming but there is also a large amount of market gardening in the area.
